ScoriaPy

scoriapy.pl

scoriapy.pl.add_text_labels(ax, median_positions, text_props_kw=None)

Add text labels at median positions on a matplotlib Axes.

Parameters:

  • ax – Target matplotlib Axes.

  • median_positions – Mapping from label to (x, y) coordinate.

  • text_props_kw (dict | None) – Optional dict of keyword arguments forwarded to ax.text.

scoriapy.pl.calculate_median_position(adata_subset, basis, overlay_attribute)

Calculate median positions of clusters in an embedding.

Parameters:

  • adata_subset – AnnData object with an embedding in .obsm[basis].

  • basis (str) – Key of the embedding in adata_subset.obsm.

  • overlay_attribute (str) – Observation column defining the groups whose medians are computed.

Returns:

Mapping from label to a 2D median coordinate.

Return type:

dict

scoriapy.pl.create_heatmap_annotation(col_df)

Create a PyComplexHeatmap.HeatmapAnnotation from a column DataFrame.

Parameters:

col_df (DataFrame) – Column annotation DataFrame whose columns will be turned into annotation tracks.

Returns:

Configured annotation object.

Return type:

PyComplexHeatmap.HeatmapAnnotation

scoriapy.pl.get_heatmap_dfs(adata, obs_cols, var_cols, scale=False)

Prepare matrices and annotation DataFrames for heatmap plotting.

Parameters:

  • adata (AnnData) – AnnData object with expression data.

  • obs_cols (List[str]) – List of observation columns to include as column annotations.

  • var_cols (List[str]) – List of variable columns to include as row annotations.

  • scale (bool) – If True, z-score rows of the expression matrix.

Returns:

Dictionary with keys "df_mat", "col_df", and "row_df".

Return type:

dict

scoriapy.pl.plot_cluster_heatmap(df_mat, col_df, row_df, figsize=(15, 15), **kwargs)

Plot a clustered heatmap with annotations for genes and cells.

Parameters:

  • df_mat (DataFrame) – Expression matrix (rows = genes, columns = cells).

  • col_df (DataFrame) – Column annotation DataFrame (index should align with columns of df_mat).

  • row_df (DataFrame) – Row annotation DataFrame (index should align with rows of df_mat and include a "gene_cat" column).

  • figsize (tuple[int, int]) – Size of the matplotlib figure.

  • **kwargs – Additional keyword arguments forwarded to PyComplexHeatmap.ClusterMapPlotter.

scoriapy.pl.plot_distribution(df, n=1000, x_intercept=-1.5)

Plot a KDE of values in df with an optional vertical cutoff line.

Parameters:

  • df (DataFrame) – DataFrame whose numeric values to visualize.

  • n (int) – Maximum number of columns to sample for plotting.

  • x_intercept (float) – Location of the vertical reference line.

scoriapy.pl.plot_embeddings_with_labels(adata, basis, color_attribute, overlay_attribute, group_col=None, subplot_width=5, text_props_kw=None)

Plot embeddings with median-position labels, optionally split by a grouping column.

Parameters:

  • adata – AnnData object with an embedding in .obsm[basis].

  • basis (str) – Key in adata.obsm for the embedding (e.g. "X_umap").

  • color_attribute (str) – Observation column used to color cells.

  • overlay_attribute (str) – Observation column used to define label groups.

  • group_col (str | None) – Optional column in adata.obs used to split the data into separate subplots.

  • subplot_width (float) – Base width of each subplot (in inches).

  • text_props_kw (dict | None) – Optional dict of keyword arguments forwarded to ax.text.

scoriapy.pl.plot_group_embeddings(adata, group_col, color, basis='X_pca_umap', **kwargs)

Create embedding plots for each group in group_col.

Parameters:

  • adata – AnnData object with an embedding in .obsm[basis].

  • group_col (str) – Column in adata.obs used to define groups.

  • color (str) – Observation column used to color cells.

  • basis (str) – Key in adata.obsm containing the embedding coordinates.

  • **kwargs – Additional keyword arguments forwarded to scanpy.pl.embedding().

scoriapy.pl.plot_pca_for_samples(adata, sample_list)

Plot PCA embeddings for a list of sample IDs.

Parameters:

  • adata – AnnData object containing a "sample" column in obs.

  • sample_list – Iterable of sample IDs to visualize.

scoriapy.pl.plot_umap_by_categories(adata, obs_columns, basis='X_umap', color='leiden', ncol=3, figsize=(15, 5), sort_order=None, cluster_to_cell_mapping=None, legend_location='on_data', point_size=None)

Plot UMAPs for each combination of categories in obs_columns.

Parameters:

  • adata – AnnData object containing an embedding in .obsm[basis].

  • obs_columns (Sequence[str]) – Sequence of observation columns whose unique combinations define subplots (e.g. ["age", "sample"]).

  • basis (str) – Key in adata.obsm containing the embedding coordinates.

  • color (str) – Observation column used to color cells (e.g. "leiden").

  • ncol (int) – Number of subplots per row.

  • figsize (tuple[int, int]) – Base figure size; actual height scales with the number of rows.

  • sort_order (Sequence[str] | None) – Optional ordering for the first component of the combined group name.

  • cluster_to_cell_mapping (Mapping[str, str] | None) – Optional mapping from cluster IDs to cell type labels for the legend.

  • legend_location (str) – Where to place legends ("on_data", "right", or "none").

  • point_size (float | None) – Optional marker size. If None, a size proportional to the total cell count is used.

scoriapy.pl.plot_umap_by_group(adata, group_column, **kwargs)

Plot UMAPs for each unique value in group_column.

Parameters:

  • adata – AnnData object with a computed UMAP embedding.

  • group_column (str) – Column in adata.obs whose unique values define subplots.

  • **kwargs – Additional keyword arguments forwarded to scanpy.pl.umap().

scoriapy.pl.plot_umap_grid_by_sample(adata, col_per_row=2, figsize_per_plot=(4, 4))

Plot a grid of UMAPs, one per sample in adata.obs['sample_name'].

Parameters:

  • adata – AnnData object with a UMAP embedding.

  • col_per_row (int) – Number of UMAP subplots per row.

  • figsize_per_plot (tuple[int, int]) – Size of each individual UMAP subplot.

Returns:

Figure containing the UMAP grid.

Return type:

matplotlib.figure.Figure

scoriapy.pl.plot_umap_param_grid(adata, min_dists=(0.1, 1, 2), spreads=(0.5, 1, 5))

Plot a grid of UMAPs for all combinations of min_dist and spread.

Parameters:

  • adata – AnnData object with precomputed neighbors/PCA, ready for UMAP.

  • min_dists (Sequence[float]) – Sequence of min_dist values to evaluate.

  • spreads (Sequence[float]) – Sequence of spread values to evaluate.

scoriapy.pl.plot_violin_genes(adata1, adata2, common_genes, group_col_adata1, group_col_adata2, subplot_width=2)

Plot violin plots for genes across specified groups from two AnnData objects.

Parameters:

  • adata1 – First AnnData object.

  • adata2 – Second AnnData object.

  • common_genes (List[str]) – List of genes to visualize.

  • group_col_adata1 (str) – Grouping column in adata1.obs.

  • group_col_adata2 (str) – Grouping column in adata2.obs.

  • subplot_width (float) – Width of each subplot in inches.

scoriapy.pl.sort_cells_by_metadata(adata, primary_sort_col, primary_categories, second_sort_col, second_categories)

Sort cells by two categorical obs columns.

Parameters:

  • adata (AnnData) – AnnData object to sort.

  • primary_sort_col (str) – Name of the primary categorical column (e.g. "age").

  • primary_categories (List[str]) – Desired ordering of categories in primary_sort_col.

  • second_sort_col (str) – Name of the secondary categorical column.

  • second_categories (List[str]) – Desired ordering of categories in second_sort_col.

Returns:

AnnData object reordered according to the sorted index.

Return type:

AnnData

scoriapy.pl.subset_adata(adata, group_col, keys, genes_map)

Subset AnnData by selected groups and genes, assigning gene categories.

Parameters:

  • adata (AnnData) – AnnData object with a populated raw attribute.

  • group_col (str) – Column in adata.obs used to select cells.

  • keys (List[str]) – Values in group_col that define the subset of cells.

  • genes_map (Dict[str, str]) – Mapping from gene name to category label. Only genes present in adata.raw.var_names are used.

Returns:

Subsetted AnnData with selected genes and cells; gene categories are stored in .var['gene_cat'].

Return type:

AnnData
